duties_responsibilities.duty: Align laser systems using concepts of auto reflection and interferometry in a class 100/1000 cleanroom.
Perform epoxy-based assembly processes to create complex opto-mechanical assemblies.
Use mechanical and/or optical measuring equipment, computer-automated test systems, laser alignment and test systems, and hand tools for mechanical assembly.
Handle optical components like lenses, mirrors, prisms and perform cleaning of optical components and assemblies using approved solvents.
Assist to help develop optical assembly process with feedback to engineers and work on new product introduction programs.
Read and follow written and verbal English work instructions, demonstrate basic understanding of optics technology, and communicate effectively in a team environment.
Operate optical test systems, and perform visual inspection of optical surfaces with adequate visual acuity.
Use computer skills for basic MS Office software, specifically Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field
